newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Didata rises in busy trade ahead of results.
newsitem.headline: Didata rises in busy trade ahead of results.

text.p: Shares in South African information technology firm Dimension Data Holdings Ltd rose in heavy volume on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange on Thursday ahead of anticipated good half year results due early in May.
"Management has been bullish about the results and we feel good about the company," a dealer said.
By 0855 GMT the share was the second most actively traded on the JSE gaining 25 cents to 15.60 rand in a volume of over 1.8 million shares valued at almost 28 million rand.
Dealers said the market was expecting earnings for the six months to end-March to be up some 40 percent.
The share has been rising steadily since Monday in busy trade from 14.10 rand to a high of 16 rand on Thursday -- a gain of 13.5 percent.
